summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The City Plan Commission of Dallas will convene on September 5, 2024, for a briefing at 9:00 AM followed by a public hearing at 12:30 PM. The meeting will be held both in-person at City Hall and via videoconference, focusing on various development and zoning matters.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes the approval of minutes from previous meetings, several development plans, zoning cases (both consent and under advisement), subdivision cases, and a certificate of appropriateness for signage. Notable items include a development plan application for Capella Park and multiple zoning cases concerning specific use permits and amendments to existing zoning districts.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include a Specific Use Permit for a late-hours restaurant on Greenville Avenue and amendments to zoning for alcoholic beverage manufacturing in the West Commerce area. The commission will also review multiple subdivision cases aimed at creating new lots from existing tracts, with staff recommendations for approval on all items.

**Action Items**:  
The commission seeks approval for the minutes of past meetings, various development plans, and zoning cases. Additionally, they will consider appointments to CPC committees and address items for reconsideration regarding previous meeting minutes. Public testimony will be allowed, with registration required in advance. 

This meeting is crucial for shaping the future development and zoning landscape in Dallas.
